text: I was born in Iran uh I lived in Iran
until I was 15 16 years old before I
went to school in England and then the
Iranian Revolution happened in 1979 my
family left Iran and I with them uh we
settled in the United States in Boston
it was right about the time that I
started my undergraduate studies at T
University so the events of 1979 in Iran
the revolution the explosion of Islamic
politics in the Middle East at the time
the questions that Americans had about
what happened in Iran what was happening
in the Middle East why Islam had all of
a sudden become so important were very
formative because in many ways I was uh
impacted by that Revolution immensely
and I was in American Universities at a
time when these questions were becoming
increasingly more
important well my Impressions were not
so much shaped by my experiences in Iran
but rather experiences in England
because I went to school in England my
school was more like Harry Potter School
it was a boarding school with all those
uh kinds of uh structures that that are
associated with English boarding schools
uh and I compared constantly the culture
of teenagers and youth and Academia and
what I knew of England uh with America
and for me the adjustment was not so
much as a middle easterner Coming to
America but as a stu somebody who'd gone
to high school in England Coming to
America while we were in Iran I always
thought it might have a life in pu have
a future in public life uh my father was
an academic he was also involved in
public life in Iran but also once in
America I gravitated much more towards
an intellectual career I knew from
undergraduate years at TS that I wanted
to be an academic intellectual questions
study of the Middle East uh debates
theoretical debates within comparative
politics history it always fascinated me
and also when you go to school in Boston
it's very easy to lose sight of the real
world and to only think of a career that
is focused on uh on intellectual
questions and because my I came also
from a family of academics it almost was
much more natural for me to go down that
road
